Class Manix

  • java.lang.Object
    • Manix

  • public class Manix
extends java.lang.Object
    Matrix Manipulator. Basic matrix manipulating functions and some quality of life functions included.
    Author:
    Wasupmacuz

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Manix(int m, int n)
      Creates a matrix with m rows and n columns.
      Manix(java.lang.Number[][] array)
      Creates a matrix from a pre-existing array.

      Gives an entire specified column of this matrix.
      static java.lang.Number[] column(java.lang.Number[][] in, int n)
      Gives an entire specified column of a specified matrix.
      java.lang.Double det()
      Finds the determinant of a matrix using LU decomposition with time complexity O(2n^3/3) if it works.
      If it fails, use Cofactor expansion with time complexity O(n!).

      Creates a new matrix and leaves this matrix unaltered.
      Manix T()
      Creates a new, transposed version of this matrix and leaves this matrix unaltered.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Provides each element of this matrix, equally spaced for readability, and with each row surrounded by vertical bars to simulate the traditional matrix notation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Manix

        public Manix(java.lang.Number[][] array)
        Creates a matrix from a pre-existing array.
        Parameters:
        array - 2d array to act as a matrix. Assumes rectangular in shape.

      • Manix

        public Manix(int m,
             int n)
        Creates a matrix with m rows and n columns.
        Parameters:
        m - The number of rows
        n - The number of columns

    • Method Detail

      • I

        public static Manix I(int size)
        Provides a new identity matrix.
        Static for quality of life.
        Parameters:
        size - Width and height of the matrix created.
        Returns:
        A square matrix with 1's on its diagonal and 0's everywhere else.

      • Null

        public static Manix Null(int rows,
                         int columns)
        Provides a new matrix with 0's everywhere.
        Calls the fill() method.
        Static for quality of life.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows this matrix should have.
        columns - The number of columns this matrix should have.
        Returns:
        fill(new Integer(0), rows, columns)

      • rand

        public static Manix rand(int rows,
                         int columns)
        Creates a new matrix with random values everywhere.
        Static for quality of life.
        Values can be scaled with mul(Number, Class) and shifted with add(Number, Class) or sub(Number, Class).
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows this matrix should have.
        columns - The number of columns this matrix should have.
        Returns:
        A matrix with a random number [0.0, 1.0) as a Double in each element.

      • fill

        public static Manix fill(java.lang.Number value,
                         int rows,
                         int columns)
        Provides a new matrix with each element specified by value.
        Static for quality of life.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to put in each element of the matrix.
        rows - The number of rows this matrix should have.
        columns - The number of columns this matrix should have.
        Returns:
        A matrix filled with any one number.

      • setVal

        public void setVal(int row,
                   int col,
                   java.lang.Number val)
        Sets a specified element to a specified value.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the element to be replaced.
        col - The column of the element to be replaced.
        val - The value to replace with.

      • mean

        public double mean()
        Calculates the arithmetic mean (average) of all elements in this matrix.
        Returns:
        The sum of all elements, divided by the number of elements.

      • T

        public Manix T()
        Creates a new, transposed version of this matrix and leaves this matrix unaltered.
        Returns:
        A transposed version of this matrix.

      • add

        public <N extends java.lang.Number> Manix add(Manix addend,
                                              java.lang.Class<N> numberType)
        Adds each element of the addend to the respective element of this matrix.
        Creates a new matrix and leaves this matrix unaltered.
        Parameters:
        addend - The matrix that we want to add onto this one.
        numberType - A subclass of Number.class.
        In essence, Double.class, Long.class, Float.class, Integer.class, Short.class, or Byte.class
        Returns:
        A new matrix with each element the sum of this one's and the addend's.

      • sub

        public <N extends java.lang.Number> Manix sub(Manix minuend,
                                              java.lang.Class<N> numberType)
        Subtracts each element of the minuend from the respective element of this matrix.
        Creates a new matrix and leaves this matrix unaltered.
        Parameters:
        minuend - The matrix that we want to subtract from this one.
        numberType - A subclass of Number.class.
        In essence, Double.class, Long.class, Float.class, Integer.class, Short.class, or Byte.class
        Returns:
        A new matrix with each element the difference of this one's and the minuend's.

      • dot

        public <N extends java.lang.Number> Manix dot(Manix multiplicand,
                                              java.lang.Class<N> numberType)
        Performs matrix multiplication with this matrix on the left side of the product.
        Creates a new matrix and leaves this matrix unaltered.
        Parameters:
        multiplicand - The matrix that we want to 'dot' with this one.
        numberType - A subclass of Number.class.
        In essence, Double.class, Long.class, Float.class, Integer.class, Short.class, or Byte.class
        Returns:
        A new matrix which is the product of the matrix multiplication.
        A.dot(B) != B.dot(A)

      • mul

        public <N extends java.lang.Number> Manix mul(java.lang.Number b,
                                              java.lang.Class<N> numberType)
        Multiplies this matrix by b.
        Creates a new matrix and leaves this one unaltered
        Parameters:
        b - The scalar to multiply the matrix by.
        numberType - A subclass of Number.class.
        In essence, Double.class, Long.class, Float.class, Integer.class, Short.class, or Byte.class
        Returns:
        A new matrix with each element being b times the respective element of this matrix

      • mul

        public <N extends java.lang.Number> Manix mul(Manix multiplicand,
                                              java.lang.Class<N> numberType)
        Hadamard multiplication: multiplies each element of the multiplicand with the respective element of this matrix.
        Creates a new matrix and leaves this matrix unaltered.
        Parameters:
        multiplicand - The matrix that we want to multiply with this one.
        numberType - A subclass of Number.class.
        In essence, Double.class, Long.class, Float.class, Integer.class, Short.class, or Byte.class
        Returns:
        A new matrix with each element the product of this one's and the multiplicand's.
        A.mul(B) == B.mul(A)

      • det

        public java.lang.Double det()
        Finds the determinant of a matrix using LU decomposition with time complexity O(2n^3/3) if it works.
        If it fails, use Cofactor expansion with time complexity O(n!). Yikes.
        Returns:
        The determinant of this matrix as a Double.

      • LU

        public Manix[] LU()
        Performs LU factorization on this matrix.
        Returns:
        A matrix array populated with Doubles with the first element being the Lower triangular matrix, and the second element being the Upper triangular matrix

      • reshape

        public Manix reshape(int rows,
                     int cols)
        Reshapes this m by n matrix into a rows by cols matrix.
        Each element is placed into the new matrix sequentially.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows in the new matrix.
        cols - The number of columns in the new matrix.
        Returns:
        A new matrix with all the same elements of this one, but in a different shape.
        The matrices have the same area and, therefore, assert m*n == rows*cols

      • row

        public java.lang.Number[] row(int m)
        Gives an entire specified row of this matrix.
        Parameters:
        m - The row to copy.
        Returns:
        A copy of the mth row of this matrix as an array of Number

      • column

        public java.lang.Number[] column(int n)
        Gives an entire specified column of this matrix.
        Parameters:
        n - The column to copy.
        Returns:
        A copy of the nth column of this matrix as an array of Number

      • row

        public static java.lang.Number[] row(java.lang.Number[][] in,
                                     int m)
        Gives an entire specified row of a specified matrix.
        Parameters:
        in - The 2d Number array to copy the row from.
        m - The row to copy.
        Returns:
        A copy of the mth row of in as an array of Number

                                        int n)

        n - The column to copy.
        Returns:

        public java.lang.Number[][] getArr()
        Provides the 2d Number array in which the values of this matrix are stored.
        Returns:
        arr, the array of Number of this matrix.

      • setArr

        public void setArr(java.lang.Number[][] arr)
        Sets the 2d Number array that this matrix is based on.
        Also updates m and n.
        Parameters:
        arr - The new 2d Number array.

      • setDecimalAccuracy

        public void setDecimalAccuracy(int accuracy)
        Sets the number of decimal places that will be displayed when toString() is called.
        Parameters:
        accuracy - A positive integer or zero.

      • getM

        public int getM()
        The number of rows in this matrix
        Returns:
        m, the number of rows.

      • getN

        public int getN()
        The number of columns in this matrix
        Returns:
        n, the number of columns.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Provides each element of this matrix, equally spaced for readability, and with each row surrounded by vertical bars to simulate the traditional matrix notation.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
